meanings.definition: To discharge or release before an expected time or event.
meanings.sent1: The hospital decided to predischarge the patient to free up the bed for other patients.
meanings.sent2: The doctor may predischarge you if your recovery progresses well.
meanings.sent3: The early predischarge surprised the patient, but they were happy to go home sooner.
meanings.sent4: The teacher predischarged the students into the weekend with a fun activity.
meanings.sent5: The storm predischarged its rain suddenly, catching everyone off guard.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency or likelihood to discharge or release before an expected time or event.
meanings.sent1: The unstable battery was predischarge, causing it to run out quickly.
meanings.sent2: The machine had a predischarge issue, leading to unexpected shutdowns.
meanings.sent3: The cat's predischarge behavior made it difficult to predict when it would run off.
meanings.sent4: The volcano showed predischarge signs, hinting at an imminent eruption.
meanings.sent5: The student's predischarge phone battery died during an important call.
